title.narrative: Addressing Disaster Displacement, Increasing Emergency Preparedness and Anticipatory Action of Humanitarian Actors and Refugees in Bangladesh

description.narrative: Every year in Bangladesh, natural disasters displace large number of people both temporarily and permanently. Refugees living in Bangladesh, who remain completely reliant on humanitarian assistance are also at heightened risk of natural disasters. For humanitarian actors, information and data, targeting and prioritizing beneficiaries, coordination, contingency planning, simplified regulatory procedures are key to deliver services to the people in need. To address these key issues, the proposed project aims to: 1. Ensure coordination through Displacement Management Cluster to address displacement issues across the country, build local capacity to effectively collect data on displacement situations to inform humanitarian assistance and recovery efforts; 2. Retain community-based disaster response mechanism in the refugee camps and ensure emergency preparedness and response coordination; 3. Strengthen Government of Bangladesh’s coordination role and technical capacity on Anticipatory Action; 4. Create an ecosystem of information and knowledge products to inform disaster risk reduction efforts and emergency response planning; 5. Simplify regulatory process and increase humanitarian access for NGOs operating in refugee response and responding to natural disasters across the country; and 6. Strengthen disaster preparedness and access by improving vehicular access roads, drainage systems and hill stabilization through Site Maintenance Engineering Project.
